title: WhatsApp for iPhone could soon get multi-account support
description: WhatsApp rolled out multi-account support for Android users in October 2023, allowing people to simultaneously use two different WhatsApp accounts on the same smartphone, eliminating the need to use the app clone feature or rely on the WhatsApp Business app trick. This feature is unavailable for iPhone users, but that should change soon. The folks at WABetaInfo report that WhatsApp is testing multi-account support for iPhone, which should allow iPhone users to use WhatsApp on their phones with two different numbers at the same time. The feature should work on iPhones similarly to Android...
excerpt: This feature has been available for Android users since October 2023. WhatsApp rolled out multi-account support for Android users in October 2023, allowing...
text: WhatsApp rolled out multi-account support for Android users in October 2023, allowing people to simultaneously use two different WhatsApp accounts on the same smartphone, eliminating the need to use the app clone feature or rely on the WhatsApp Business app trick. This feature is unavailable for iPhone users, but that should change soon. The folks at WABetaInfo report that WhatsApp is testing multi-account support for iPhone, which should allow iPhone users to use WhatsApp on their phones with two different numbers at the same time. The feature should work on iPhones similarly to Android smartphones. The source says they discovered this development in version 25.2.10.70 of WhatsApp for iOS' beta app, but the feature is still unavailable for beta users, so they will have to wait for future updates on the beta channel to start using WhatsApp with two different numbers on iPhone at the same time. And once the development is complete, the multi-account support should roll out to all WhatsApp users on iOS worldwide, which could take a few months. Source
html:
WhatsApp rolled out multi-account support for Android users in October 2023, allowing people to simultaneously use two different WhatsApp accounts on the same smartphone, eliminating the need to use the app clone feature or rely on the WhatsApp Business app trick. This feature is unavailable for iPhone users, but that should change soon.

The folks at WABetaInfo report that WhatsApp is testing multi-account support for iPhone, which should allow iPhone users to use WhatsApp on their phones with two different numbers at the same time. The feature should work on iPhones similarly to Android smartphones.

The source says they discovered this development in version 25.2.10.70 of WhatsApp for iOS' beta app, but the feature is still unavailable for beta users, so they will have to wait for future updates on the beta channel to start using WhatsApp with two different numbers on iPhone at the same time. And once the development is complete, the multi-account support should roll out to all WhatsApp users on iOS worldwide, which could take a few months.

Source
